alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Smyth, south central Bland, Wythe and north central Grayson Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 433 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Comers Rock, or near Speedwell, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wytheville... Bland... Rural Retreat... Max Meadows... Speedwell... Fort Chiswell... and Cripple Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
